I'm a Staff Scientist at Oak Ridge National Laboratory (ORNL), working in the Accelerator Physics Group at the Spallation Neutron Source (SNS). Previously, I completed a Ph.D. in physics at the University of Tennessee, Knoxville and a B.S. in physics at Wheaton College (IL).

My research focuses on the measurement, prediction, and control of intense beams in high-power accelerators. I'm specifically interested in (i) collective effects and instabilities, (ii) beam shaping, and (iii) phase space reconstruction. [Here](./research/index.qmd) is a more detailed overview. I sometimes write about my work on my [blog](https://austin-hoover.github.io/blog/).
